poem:
Title: Battlefield of Shadows

There, in a shifting parade of pretenses,
Taylor-Johnson, dismounting his high horse in the paddock,
A twist of plot, whisperings echo, latent suspense.
Thigh striking with the rhythm of a backfired clock,
Discontent lingers, a bluff in play,
A cunning agent's ploy, discord in the air.
An open question hangs, who'll save the day?
In the role of Bond, who dares?
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Keoghan, Madden, James Martin: who should be James Bond, if Aaron Taylor-Johnson is out? Just as the runners and riders were parading around the paddock, Aaron Taylor-Johnson has sensationally dismounted and stalked back to the changing room, thoughtfully tapping his whip against his thigh. What happened? Did his agent overplay things by sneakily leaking negotiations to the press, hoping the subsequent acclaim would nail down a whopping fee? Did they get their bluff called? Who". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
